result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zachary R Nichols in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Zachary R Nichols. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Defendant has been enrolled in treatment but the State is requiring different treatment to comply with the offer.
Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:20 AM Defendant Zachary R Nichols in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests more time for defendant to obtain treatment to comply with terms of the State's offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Atty. Tapia.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:27 PM Defendant Zachary R Nichols in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
